First useful comparison 1 First useful comparison 1.1 Description 1.2 Simulation Results

First useful comparison 1 First useful comparison 1.1 Description Comparing populations with a fitness contraint to populations with no fitness constraint. Simulate 10 datasets with 1024 individuals and uniformly assigned fitness scores. Assign the first 1+2+4+8=15 sequences a fitness of 1 - to prevent massive parts of the dataset from getting excluded. Then, do a fitness based selection with a score of 0.05. Assign that as sim_id n to group 1. Next select that same number of individuals from the last generation completely ignoring the fitness score and assign that as sim_id n+1 to group 2. Repeat until 10 simulations in each dataset. 1.2 Simulation Results The following graphs and tables present a summary of a set of simulations that can be divided into 2 groups.
